column2: blessed813, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking the medicine in January, using 1 drop per night. In about 3 months, my eye was red,dry, very painful and very sensitive to light. My eye doctor sent me to a specialist who've since then taken me off the medicine and gave me other eye drops. I even had to take a pain killers, because the pain was so bad. The problems still exist, and I'm having a little trouble reading and focusing even with my glasses on.

column2: lovelyMe, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Overall, the drug is okay. Sometimes it stings when I use it and other times, it doesn't. Also, I sometimes have sinus issues after using this drug. Other than that, I haven't had any significant issues with it.

column2: hippapa, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: just started my head hurts and i have an unusual dual optic nerve yes 2 optic nerves in one eye and i am close to being blind and the drs are lining up to see this dual optic nerve and im in pain hope one of them can find out how to help me

column2: d.d., 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Works fine for glaucoma pressure. Very expensive--ask your dr. for samples if you don't have ins. coverage.  Pull lower lid down a bit and drop the solution in the lower lid pocket.

column2: jbowman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Increased sensitivity to light, eye pain, itchiness of the eyes, crustiness in the am when I wake up and eye pain.

column2: bassman, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: lower eye pressure,eye lids red, after 3 months had ED for first time ever.has anybody had this problem

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have some trouble gettihg the drops in exactly on the first try. Also I am an early morning person and when I am ready to settle down for the evening to read, watch TV, etc, I often fall asleep and then it's 1:00, 2:00, 3:00 am and don't know if I should put in the drops then or skip a day. Also, it stings a little when I put in the drops and I have a constant red lines in the whites of the eye that I've never had before I started using Travatan.

column2: travatanz, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: it makes my throat more sensative and nose runny if I apply it without care and do not blot away the excess.

column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: (caregiver writing) my daughter has juvenile glaucoma and has used travatan z for 10 months.  she has had side effects like bloodshot eyes, longer/thicker lashes, and maybe dry eyes.  IOP has slowly gone down which is very encouraging.  we like the 1 drop per night ease of usage.  here's a great tip from doctor to apply the 1 drop onto the corner of eye with eye closed, then allow drop to absorb down into eye (can blink a little if needed).

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Didn't cause the eye swelling that I had with Alphagan P but afer using for two weeks I started having insomnia, chest pains, anxity and extremely high blood pressure come on thirty minutes after using the drops. column2: hiqual, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using Travatan Z for about a month.  The only side effects have been redness in the eye and dryness.  I have had cataract surgery in one eye and I use the drops in both eyes, very effective in dropping the pressure.

column2: JimmyM, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My IOP has dropped significantly, however my vision has worsened, am much more sensitive to light and have overall eye discomfort.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Used travatanz & vision declined rapidly before cataract surgery.  After surgery L eye 20/20 R 20/30 but eyes red, felt like sand in them, with pain behind eyes.  Dr. recommended lubricant drops.  Vision decline now L 20/30 R 20/40.  Didnt consult Dr. and discontinued using Travatanz.  Have excluded nonocular side effects!  Will vision improve after discontinued use?  Unable to see rxlist terms & conditions.  Disconnected when tried to submit this review the 1st time.

column2: Goodboy, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The first day I used this product my vision was very blurred and my entire eye and the area around my eye was red and swollen. The pain in my eye was so intense that I had a headache with nausea all day.  I will never take this product or any like medication again.  It has discouraged me from using any drops at all.  Not sure I want to chance this terrible experience again. What is the chance of this damaging my eye?
